Reviews.Title: “Safe location and big rooms”
Reviews.Author: Cam S
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights in April 2012. Good location, right by the police station and government building. Big rooms, comfy bed and $15 unlimited movie promo was good; 24 hours. Downfall breakfast room was always busy and wifi for only an hour a day. Able to walk everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Recent Stay at the Hotel Nazionale”
Reviews.Author: Kara G
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect and I couldnt say enough great things about it. I stayed recently with my boyfriend and we had originally only booked one night but since we fell in love with the hotel we booked another and didnt want to leave. Patrick, one of the nicest people I met in Rome, helped me out greatly and wanted to make sure that we were more than satisfied. You wont be dissapointed if you stay here and the location is prime.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ana_diav
Reviews.Content: We were a family of four and booked two hotel rooms. One had been renovated and the other had not. The rooms were the same cost and came with breakfast. My advise is to request a renovated room. However, I don't think you'll be disappointed either way. The location is wonderful. We walked to all the sites with ease.

Reviews.Title: “Good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: palooja
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nazionale was a very good option for a weekend-break in Rome. The nearest metro station was about five minutes walk from the hotel, and it was pretty easy to get to the hotel from the airport. We just booked in advance a shuttle from airport. However, if you arrive late at night I highly recommend to take a taxi. We took a taxi when travelld from the city back to the airport and the price (40 euros if I remember correctly) was about the same but it was much quicker than a shuttle service. Took about 40 minutes at nine o'clock in the morning. The other thing we liked in this hotel was that it served a good breakfast. We just ate in the morning and next time late in the afternoon. Make sure that you ask for a cup of cappuccino or espresso from the staff. It's much better than the coffee from the machine. There were also fresh fruits available. Then about the room. We got a room from the first floor even though we asked one from the upper level. However, the room was quiet and nice. It was quite big too! The view was on Montecitirio square. We would have appreciated for a free wifi but they served it only for one hour per your stay. Afterwards the price was 10 euros for 24 hours. Do not be afraid of policemen because the hotel is located next to Italian parliament so there are always policemen around. And a tip for a traveler: Behind the hotel there are many ice-cream bars and especially one with tens of flavours!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, fabulous location.”
Reviews.Author: JessicaSnow
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from the 5th -9th March for our honeymoon, As we booked through Thomsons we were given a complimentary bottle of Prosecco whic was delivered to the room as soon as we checked in, which was a lovely start to our holiday. We had a lovely room on the 4th floor with great views across the city of the roof tops and St Peter's dome. Perfect location, we did buy Roma passes at the Termini but didnt need them as everything is in walking distance (even if you get lost like we did!). Breakfast was the same every morning but always fresh and tasty. I'd recommend trying the freshly squeezed orange and carrot juice to kick start your day, its lovely! The staff were always friendly and helpful and the nibbles they gave us with our bar drinks were always an added bonus. We didnt have dinner in the hotel, but took a guide book by rick steves with us and ate in his recommended restaurants. If you do this, avoid the Osteria di Fontana near the Pantheon. Very over priced for very bland food, Miscellenea round the back of the Panteon was great for cheap food and a great atmosphere,seems to be a hit with the locals too which is always a good sign. Overall we had a fantastic holiday. we would really recommend the hotel, not only for the location but for the standards of service too - faultless.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JMcKerr
Reviews.Content: Arriving after a self imposed frantic rush to the airport (parking car at 4.10 for a 4.50 flight - still needing to check in) fearing this was going to be the mother of all disastrous trips from hell, we were met by one of natures gentle-men, Patrick. He quickly checked us in and gave us a lovely spacious room overlooking the Piazza. Champagne on ice and fresh fruit awaited us (grazie mille, Susan, ti amiano sempre). Breakfast had good choice of product with 'boil your own egg' a favorite pastime for me with mixed results. Bathroom spacious and clean with robe and shower slippers thrown in. All location information as per previous contributors. Great Macchiato around the corner at Giolitti and super ice cream around the next corner in Della Palma ( display and choice of flavours incredible). In summation great hotel, great staff and great location, if you get a good price to stay, think of nowhere else.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION, GREAT STUFF”
Reviews.Author: sweetnousha
Reviews.Content: location : it's the best location ever you can stay in Rome , 2 min walk to the trevi fountain, 3 min to the pentheon,7 min to piazza navona , 8 min to the spanish steps, 10 min to the collesuem. near the shopping area in Via del corso and via condotti , very safe place near a government building .. Bus station is very very near just 2 min from which u can go everywhere with just 1 euro.. staff: staff are very very friendly and really helpful , they made upgrade to our rooms without asking !! they are really great specially (emiliano ) rooms : we were a group of 8 persons , we took 4 different rooms : #308,#306,#223 and #222 all was really great and different styles !! but mainly has the antique style which i really loved it alot to feel Rome :), very very comfort bed !! and large bathrooms Breakfast : it was good enought and had many varieties .. includes : tea, coffee, capputcino , juices and water the only thing that i hope they can do , is to have a free wifi , at least in the receiption area... if i go to ROme again , FOR SURE WILL STAY THERE :) had a great stay there , thank you all the staff :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff; really made a difference”
Reviews.Author: CalanSurrey
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels in Rome on business and as a rule the staff have been really good but they really were exceptional at this hotel. The rooms were very clean and comfortable; breakfast great. Unfortunately a party of rugby fans were staying for one of the nights I was there and I had some idiot banging on my door at 2.30am in the morning shouting that "It's not funny, let me in" , rather than have some drunken lout fall in if I opened the door I called the front desk and they immediately sent someone up who spoke very gently to the drunk pointing out they were at the wrong room and managed to deal with a tricky situation with a great deal of aplomb. We also had to make several requests for printing/loan of umbrellas etc. and every single request was met with complete service, polite; efficient and willing. The Hotel is ideally placed but it is because of the staff that I would really recommend this hotel to my colleagues, friends and family, they make the difference

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: deconstructoboy
Reviews.Content: The best thing the hotel has to recommend to it is location: you are central and getting around is really, really easy. However, the hotel itself does little to deserve its "official" 4-star rating; it seems to be doing things OK but not really getting the details down that make some hotel stays magical. Little things, like decent coffee at breakfast, or a new bar of soap from the cleaning crew (really, I had to snag a new one off a cleaning cart after our little soap bar was used up and not replaced after two days). The rooms themselves seem slightly shabby. The tub leaked, leaving a huge puddle on the tile floor, but I thought that this probably explained the water stains on the ceiling of our room ... The non-free high-speed wifi is deeply irritating, especially for a hotel that bills itself as business-friendly (they have an attached conference center). You get an hour of "free" wifi with your room each day but at speeds that are glacial (reminded me of dialup). The front desk staff was exemplary, always friendly and helpful; the restaurant staff uniformly grumpy. I've stayed here several times since 2003 and really like the place but I feel it used to be better ... and you cannot beat the location. 3 minutes walk to the Pantheon, 7 to Piazza Navona, Ara Pacis or the Trevi Fountain, 12-15 to the base of the Spanish Steps.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, almost great”
Reviews.Author: Gallusdomesticus
Reviews.Content: Stazyed there in April 2011 for a congress, arrival was a bit tough because i wasnt prepared for the cobblestones, but soon I fount out why everyone is wearing training shoes in Rome. Got a room on the top floor, which was obviously built later on top of the hotel, wasnt too stylish from utside but provided and asonishing view on the roof garden of the house next door. The rooftop room tended to get very hot in the afternoon even in April but the view over the rooftops was wonderful. The staff was generally nice, althiugh on the day of my arrival i was sleeping in the afternoon when a lady came to check if i needed anything for the night and she actually walked me up so she can ask this. Also, there were workers reconstructing something on the roof, and the workers went outside from the top floor, and were very loud talking in the corridor early in the morning. Also they had a dining room there and were talking there very loudly. When i told the receptionist that the workers wake me up at six and maybe he could ask them not to shout on the corridors he got upset and told me he wont stop roof works for me. I tried to explain that i have no problem when they outside working only when on the corridor but he didnt seem to believe they really walk me up, so eventually i gave up. Apart from that i had no problem with the staff. The location is good, although it is located next to some parliament like building and when people are demonstrating the area is closed and you have to go around, Also taxis cant go straight to the hotel so you have to walk a bit. But all attractions are quite nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly and helpful. Perfect location, just few minutes from the main shopping street Via del Corso. Around 30-40 minutes from Vatican. There are lots of restaurants around offering extensive menus for good prices.The room was beautiful with a very comfortable bed and a view over the square. Breakfast very good.

Reviews.Title: “4 stars hotel in the middle of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Odd_Bergen
Reviews.Content: The hotel has spacious rooms and good service. This was a historic elegant hotel, welcoming and beautifully finished. Hotel is located in the heart of Rome's historic center, the hotel is in an 18th-century building, close to the capital’s most famous monuments, and just 100 m from Fontana Di Trevi. The breakfast was very good and good selection of food.

Reviews.Title: “Roman holidays”
Reviews.Author: Vaquitalekker
Reviews.Content: This has been our second time in Hotel Nazionale and we must confess that it was a 180 degrees change in comparison with our first visit earlier this year. From the beginning the staff at the Reception desk was very welcoming and they took their time to provide us with maps and information on what to do in Rome during the holiday season before sending our luggage to the room. We were gladly surprised because during our last visit they barely gave us the room key and indicated the location of the lift. The room assigned to us was well appointed and in much better condition. It really showed that it was recently updated. We had a magnificent view of the famous Roman rooftops along with St. Peter's cupola. Breakfast was also improved with a wider selection of fruits, cold cuts and bakery. We highly appreciate having the traditional Panettone on Christmas morning. The staff at the bar was very helpful and cordial. We really enjoyed sharing a glass of Prosecco with our family and friends while waiting for dinner or just before exploring the restaurants around. Indeed the best asset of the Hotel is its location: just few minutes away from the most famous tourist attractions, archeological sites, nice shopping streets, beautiful buildings and different types of Restaurants. Overall we had a great time and we are looking forward to return to Rome soon.

Reviews.Title: “Stuffy Luxury”
Reviews.Author: murphy2
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week from Nov. 18-26, 2011. I must say that our room was breathtaking when we were shown to it. Huge windows that opened over the courtyard Piazza Montechitorio with the Italian Parliment building as our only neighbor. No traffic whatsoever. The room had a large chrystal chandelier like out of Versailles. King size bed. Large bathroom. Quiet. Clean. The only real down side was the AC had been shut off for the season and the room was on the warm side forcing us to open the 8' tall windows which let in the noise of the morning cleaning, trash pickup, occazional protester, etc. One of the staff, Patrick, spoke English and genuinely tried to act as our tour guide. The other staff were stuffy and rather brusque. When they tried to charge us 15 euros to print out our shuttle voucher to the airport that really did not go over too well. their breakfast, while artfully displayed and set up, was the exact same thing every day and all in all was bland and not interesting after a couple of days. The great thing was that around the corner of the hotel was Giolitti, Rome's best gilotteria! The location was very convenient to walking to the sites. Trevi Fountain is about 3 minutes away. Via de Campo is a main street that leads to the Piazza de Popolo in 15 minutes. So would we stay here again, it was nice but probably not. It seemed more geared to the politicos, had little to offer we tourists, and had nothing in the way of conveniences in case you needed something. But if you desire quiet, luxury and roominess, this might be worth looking into.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: gabizolt
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, all the central Rome sites are within easy walking distance. Very good location for shopping too. Friendly staff, large and comfortable room and good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: DonnafromDC
Reviews.Content: The base price of this hotel was more expensive than our price point of 200 Euros, but we found a great discount (20%) by paying in advance. Anyway, the hotel is lovely. It has a nice (fancy) public room and a charming breakfast room. The front desk folks were very helpful (and we were clearly tourists of no importance). The room was spotless and the bed was as comfortable as my bed at home. The bathroom was large and well-appointed with full-size hair dryer and rain water shower. We had a room on the back, so it was very quiet. We had a partial view of St. Peter's in the distance (partial because an intervening building blocked about half of it but it was lovely nonetheless). We were just across a plaza, one block down, and across another plaza from D'Oro Tazio (approximate name), my new favorite latte place in the world. We could walk to everything (Vatican and Trastevere are a little far but the ancient Rome sites, Piazza Navona, Campo Fiori, and the Trevi fountain are just short strolls away. (The hotel is on the square that houses the parliament building (designed by Bernini), so there were demonstrations going on and I'll bet that during the week the front rooms can get some noise.) The breakfast was very good. Several kinds of bread and rolls, hams, and sweet breads )pastries), some fresh fruit, cereal, yogart, and eggs you could soft boil for yourself. They have a self-serve cappachino machine (ugh) but they will make you one that is okay from another machine. (But do yourself a favor and stop each morning for a 1.10 euro tiny but heavenly cappachino at D'Oro.) If you want a place that is higher end than the moderate hotels, but not quite luxurious, I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “5 Days & 4 Nights in Glorious Rome 9th - 13th November 2011”
Reviews.Author: Ronnie G
Reviews.Content: Departing Belfast International on Wednesday afternoon and arriving in Rome less than 3 hours later. The hotel Nazionale is situated in the Plazza Montecitorio, an ideal location for everything. 10 Mins from Trevi Fountain 20 mins from Spanish Steps and 5 minutes from pick up & drop off point for all city tour buses.....and very very quiet. We were there as Prime Minister Berlisconi was being retired and the hotel shared the square with the Parliamentary HO which as can be imagined was a hive of activity all a BIG PLUS. The weather the whole time was fantastic - 70oF and sunny. Light trousers and T shirts the order of the day. A bit cooler however through the city streets with high buildings blocking off the sunlight. Went to Rome expecting great things and definately not disappointed. All tourist attractions lived up to our imaginations. The modern development of Rome has not impinged on the historic sites. Great restaurant/cafe near to hotel - La Scaletta in Via della Maddalena. Super atmosphere, great waiting staff and able to have a bit of fun. Returned there having sampled a less than memorable eaterie the name best forgotten. Romans very pleasant people. We did not encounter any bars or night clubs, but the street side cafes were fantastic. The city was vibrant and not just with tourists. Rome is a very expensive city. Beautiful Greco White wine - €22. Bottle of beer - €10. Meal for two including wine and 4 x alcholic drinks no desert - €110. Disturbing to see so many street beggers, especially around Vatican area. In conclusion glad to have made the trip, a fantastic city with plenty to see and walking is recommended, although we did take advantage of site seeing bus, only because we did not realise how close everything was to our hotel. Tip do not be conned by "tour guides" at tourist sites offering queue jumping for €13 is a take on.The time of year we visited there was little queuing to be done. Finally Rome airport departing arrangements the worst I have experienced after LA.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - even amid Berlusconi fiasco outside...”
Reviews.Author: Aaron W
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Nazionale last week during a short stay in Rome. Upon arrival to our room, my wife took a shower to discover the removable shower head wouldn't stay in place making it difficult to shower. Upon check-in we had also forgotten to request a view of the Piazza. So, when my wife got out of the shower she called the front desk, explained the shower issue. Before she could ask to change rooms they told us they would send someone up in 2 minutes to move our things to a room that would meet our satisfaction. My wife then asked if we could have a view of the piazza. About two minutes later, someone came upstairs, helped us with our bags and moved us to room 215. Not only was the room and the view of the piazza fantastic, the customer service was superior from everyone on their staff. We stayed during the whole parliament/Berlusconi fiasco and because the parliament building is in the same piazza there were hundreds of people hanging around including dozens of news crews from around the world. Many of these TV crews and personalities were staying in the hotel and it was sold out. With all of the commotion, the staff was pleasant, extremely helpful and helped us have a lovely stay. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulselfridge
Reviews.Content: We recently had a weekend at the Nazionale. Great location, great room, excellent and helpful staff. Thankyou, Nazionale.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect central position for all sets of interest”
Reviews.Author: fleetweld
Reviews.Content: Can walk to almost all sites of interest from this hotel. Friendly helpful staff. Very quiet location in parliament square. Could not fault this hotel and would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Central and convenient”
Reviews.Author: jilona4548
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just right if you are looking to stay near some of the more reknowned sights of Rome. We wanted to be near to the Rotunda, and were just a two to three minute walk away. We were also able mid afternoon to comfortably saunter to the Vatican by way of the river, and in a large loop and back to the hotel in time for aperitifs at six! The hotel is very near to excellent shops and restaurants, but make sure you head south (and not west as we were advised by staff), to find the nearest bite to eat that isn't an ice cream or a gourmet meal. Staff were friendly and efficient. Our bedroom, although having slightly dated decor, was clean and spacious with high cielings and long curtains adding to the ambience, and the bathroom large, clean and beautifully tiled: a nice touch were the damask hand towels. The bed was king size and comfortable. Our few niggles were that no coffee or tea facilities were included in the room, the corridor carpets on the second floor where we stayed needed a deep clean, and the breakfast buffet was confusing in terms of how it was laid out. All fairly minor when the overall impression and value for money was very good. Although the hotel seems fairly austere, we would recommend it. We travelled to and from Termini station by taxi, about ten to 15 minutes and 10 to 15 Euros depending on the driver!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: tiklaima
Reviews.Content: Full of caracter, charming, rooms spacious and comfortable, personnell friendly. Walking distance to all turist attractions and in the middle of shopping area.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks to the Hotel Nazionale in Roma”
Reviews.Author: Karen B
Reviews.Content: I would very much like to say thankyou to the Nazionale with its staff and administration for a very pleasant stay at your hotel in October 2011. I am a frequent visitor of Rome and I always try to book into your hotel. As I often am travelling alone woman, I feel very safe and secure at your hotel. At the same time the rooms are clean and proper, the maids are eager to do a good job.The breakfast is fully continental and the waiters friendly and polite, same as the reseptionstaff is. I am working in the "tourist-business", and have visited many hotels. Hotel Nazionale is of the better of its category, in my opinion. Of great importance to me is the location; in the very center of the historical Rome. Believe it: 30 years ago I had my first stay at Hotel Nazionale, and I do hope it will be many more visits in the future. Thanks again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: curran5
Reviews.Content: We recently travelled for two weeks in Italy and our last stay was at Hotel Nazionale in Rome. I would hightly recommend this hotel for so many reasons - it is a very modern 4 star hotel at a reasonable price!! After staying in more European style hotels we found this a real treat at the end of our trip, beautifully appointed rooms and very modern bathrooms. The hotel has a very nice lounge where it was wonderful to have a glass of wine after touring all day. The continental breakfast is unbelievable, everything you can imagine.....and it is included in the room rate!! The hotel staff was so accomodating and the location was perfect!! it is located right next to Parliment and walking distance to Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, and also we walked to Coleseum and Forum (cab home :)) We actually walked around the corner our last nite looking for a place for dinner and ended up eating at a restaurant in front of the Pantheon in the square.....it was such a perfect location!!

Reviews.Title: “Condescending staff”
Reviews.Author: Karlie
Reviews.Content: This is not the type of hotel me and my husband would normally stay in, but we were only going to be in Rome for one evening before we flew home and wanted to be in a great location near the Pantheon and the other main attractions. It is much more expensive than we would ever normally spend, but we got somewhat of a deal and wanted to treat ourselves. We had been to Rome before so just wanted to stroll around and have an evening among the beautiful sites. We usually prefer small B&Bs with more personal service. We arrived at the hotel with our suitcases and backpacks after a five hour train ride. The man at the front desk was somewhat friendly, but in a contrived way. We asked about getting a taxi to the airport the next morning, and all he did was try to push their limo service on us, which is more than a taxi. We’ve been to Rome and have taken a cab to the airport before, so we know that it is a 40 EUR fixed rate. He was trying to make us think that it may or may not be higher than that, implying that the taxi drivers could rip us off, which isn’t possible. There were other people checking in beside us that were in a higher age bracket than us and were most likely more well off than us. They were getting much nicer treatment, getting everything explained to them. Our guy didn’t even tell us anything about breakfast, I overheard it from the other group. When they were done they were offered the services of the bell hop. We were not and handled our bags ourselves. When we checked out the next morning we asked the (different) guy to call the taxi for us and he also tried to get us to take the limo. No thanks. He was very cold and impersonal and hardly talked to us. I felt like since we are probably not in the regular demographic of people who stay in this hotel, the staff were condescending towards us and did not treat us equally to other guests. The room itself was fine. We had a great view onto the piazza. We didn’t spend much time in there but it worked fine for us. The decor could use a serious update. Very dated and tacky. Hideous carpet. Wifi is a rip off at 10 EUR a day. Breakfast is mostly included and had quite a bit of selection. Eggs and omelettes cost, and were outrageously priced at 8 to12 EUR. The location is absolutely fantastic, with the Pantheon a few minutes walk and the Coloseeum about 15 minutes, but I would never want anyone to stay somewhere where the staff are so blatantly rude and stereotyping towards people who they don’t think fit in at their establishment. The behaviour of the front desk staff is totally inappropriate, as we are all paying money to stay there and should all be treated the same and with genuine kindness.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Karo8083
Reviews.Content: The rooms are large and clean. The location is excellent and centrally located. Breakfast was good... lots to choose from and well managed. Concierge was hit or miss during our stay, some were great others were ambivalent. all in all i would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Italian Vacation”
Reviews.Author: satgarn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Hotel Nazionale for three nights at the beginning of our two week trip. From the very beginning of our attempts to book our stay, the staff was helpful, prompt and followed through on every request we had. I have stayed in the very centrally located property twice now and would not hesitate to do so again!! It is in the middle of everything and within walking distance of most. Rooms are clean and very nice. Bathrooms modern and breakfast is excellent. Complimentary wi-fi would be our only request for future consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location, appalling reception and concierge”
Reviews.Author: RPRPow
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, quiet rooms aided by the lack of traffic in the square. The rooms were pleasant, clean and well appointed. The concierge desk was a major disappointment and a reason why I would not be recommending this hotel or returning. Excluding the reception staff the hotel would easily rate one notch higher. Reception was rude, unhelpful and not particularly knowledgeable about restaurants or requirements at major sites (eg we were told by one we needed to show passports to sites...). Either this or they simply did not care to share the information. We were not the only dissatisfied customers as a couple were having a clear argument about charges at another point in time. Maybe this was due to them charging E10 per day to connect to the wifi without clear notes to advise. Waiting staff were fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: strato57
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 4 nights at Hotel Nationale on Piazza Montecitorio, arriving Sept 5, on a combined business/vacation trip... This hotel had been recommended to me by a friend and I was able to find a "reasonable late booking rate" on the Hotel website. Rome is very expensive , particularly to find a good hotel in the historic district. The day before leaving for Rome, I read in newspapers that a "general strike" was to happen on Tuesday, 6 September..... not a good thing for a visitor... and the day after my arrival... Upon arrival at the hotel, the Front office staff was helpful in trying to confirm as to what would be open, what would be closed i.e. on the following day ( General strike) ( although no one seemed to be certain as to what would happen during the general strike ) I arose early on 6 Sept, - Day of strike and the bus's, metro were running !..... I took bus to Colisseum for the Special under ground tour.. (previous --- prepaid reservations required ) but Colisseum was closed.... due to strike !!! ( I had been assured that Colliseum would be OPEN... and that public Transportation would be closed ) Instead.... public Trans was working ( at that time) and the museums were Closed !!! After discovering that Colosseo was closed,,,, I tried to take bus or Metro back to central Historico area...... but now both the bus's and Metro were CLOSED !! In the meantime,,, thousands of people were assembling in the Colosseo area for the Strike !! Police were assembling so this did not look like a good place to hang around !!! So.,. walked back to Centro Historico area.... a pleasant walk,,, approx 20 minutes to get where I needed to go to .. ------- Note: Bus's, Metro re-opened several hours later.... so Public Transportation was closed only for a few hours.. ( due to General Strike but most all museums were closed for the entire day) Church's remained open.. (i.e.Church's were not closed due to General Strike !! ) At the hotel, Front Desk staff helped me to call Reservations office and re-schedule my Colesseo reservations for following day... very helpful... Front desk also called to book my tour for Pallazo Valentini..... a new attraction in Roma that requires reservations.. ( must reserve a tour, either in English or Italian) ....This place is a newly opened attraction in Roma... and IMO,,, is a MUST SEE for anyone visiting Roma.. mulit-media attraction.... When booking my room on hotel's website, I had requested a room overlooking Piazza but upon arrival at hotel... such a room was not available. The room that I arrived into was a large spacious double room... very nice but no view.. i.e. a small window looking out the back... Whenst traveling, I do not spend much time in hotel room but do like some type of view ( if available) when in room. I requested a room change at Front Desk,,, and when doing so, was warned that "there might be some noise "... i.e due to the general strike". I packed my bags, and left hotel early in the morning ... requesting that my room be changed.. Returning to hotel, late afternoon, Front Desk had moved my bags to a new room, smaller,, but with a wonderful view,.... overlooking piazza.... and the strike !! Strike was indeed noisy... so I pulled out my faithful ( don't leave home without them) earplugs..... and slept like a baby.. ( I do not believe that front rooms would be noisy otherwise ) This room ( albeit small) was comfortable and had a great view... overlooking piazza, obelisk, Marcus Aurelius column in the background and the Italian Parliment building... The breakfast was superb... the staff most helpful,,,,, a great location... Public transportation hubs are a few minutes walk away on the Corso..... My only complaint......Nazionale Roma Hotel charges 10 E, daily, to use internet .. There is a computer for guests in lobby area and wireless service is available in your room.. .... but at a cost of 10 euros , per day.... To me,,, this is not necessary.... Most ALL of the low, mid priced and higher priced hotels , throughout Europa, are offering FREE wireless service and a FREE computer point within the hotel , for the convenience of their guests.... for FREE... i.e NO charge... It costs a hotel , virtually nothing... to offer their guest free internet, free wireless.... but to charge 10 E .... seems excessive , in my opinion... and is not "guest friendly".. I look forward to returning to this historic hotel... a wonderful, helpful staff and great location is a real plus for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we had more time to spend in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: yalopez
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay at the Nazionale. We arrived earlier than check-in, but were able to go to our room right away. Every member of the staff was always courteous and helpful. We asked for suggestions for restaurants in the area, and were provided two very good restaurants to try; both within walking distance and both really good. Can't say enough good things about the staff, but shortly after we arrived, we noticed a small water leak in a corner of the room. I contacted the front desk to let them know so they could check room above ours and fix water leak before more damage could occur. Rather than disturb us to fix leak in upstairs room, they moved us to a suite. I found that a nice touch -- we were not expecting that at all!! Breakfast buffet, which was included, was unexpectedly nice. Good variety. Everything was fresh and nicely presented. I had never seen kiwis that BIG! Both rooms we had during our stay were clean and well kept. I particularly liked the view from the windows in the first room we had -- St. Peter's dome in the distance was what you would expect in a postcard. Just gorgeous. The second room had a view of the Pantheon...also gorgeous. My daughter and I walked everywhere. The Nazionale is really at the center of it all. There are signs posted everywhere indicating direction of where the different sights are so it's difficult to get lost. We had our choice of gelato every night on the way back to the hotel. Can't wait to start planning next trip to Rome. I'll definitely stay here again. One thing I wasn't too happy about, and I really don't think it's the hotel, is the fact that only a "select" number of cars can come to the hotel's doors. I hired independent transfers to and from hotel, and both drivers had to drop us off and pick us up on Via del Corso -- about two blocks away. We had to walk with two suitcases through Piazza Colonna and the Palazzo di Montecitorio. Had I known this in advance, I would have contacted the hotel directly to make arrangements for drivers to drop us off and pick us up at hotel's front door. All said and done, the staff was wonderful and the location was perfect. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico!!”
Reviews.Author: joyfulNorfolk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this great hotel last week-21 to27 Aug and it was truly excellent. It is in a very central location and very safe as it is on the parliament square and is patrolled 24 hrs. The room was spotless and beautifully cool which was very important as the temp was 42 deg on some days! The service was great too-all staff were excellent.Oh-and Rome was pretty special too! Breakfast was served in a lovely restaurant and was good and plentiful. All in all a fantastic experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, spacious rooms, and great complementary breakfast”
Reviews.Author: PL2011
Reviews.Content: GREAT LOCATION-CENTRAL YET QUIET: The hotel entrance faces the large pedestrian Piazza Montecitorio and is adjacent to the Parliament Building. The hotel is in a very charming old area, and is a very short walk (5 minutes) to the Pantheon and wonderful piazzas and restaurants. One of the best gelatto places is also just around the corner. It's about a 10-15 minute walk to the Forum in one direction and 15 minute walk to the Spanish Steps in the other. All our rooms faced the Piazza and it was amazingly quiet at night (we were there when Parliament was not in session, so I am not sure how quiet it would be other times). EACH ROOM IS UNIQUE: We stayed at the hotel 2 times. The first time we had 2 Deluxe rooms on the 4th floor (the highest floor), the second we had 2 Deluxe rooms on the 3 floor. Each room was completely different in layout and decor, but they all had updated nice bathrooms, 'antique' (or older) furnishings, high ceilings, newer very well insulated windows and shutters that opened, a very large flat screen TV, and a minibar. The ceilings on the 4th floor are quite high, but lower than those on all other floors. The only minor negative was the wallpaper in the rooms was starting to curl at the edges. That combined with the eclectic antique decor could be either charming or a hint of shabby chic - depending upon your taste. I am not sure if all the hotel rooms face the Piazza, but I would recommend those rooms as it is a pleasant view, and the rooms are quiet and sunny. The other rooms would face very narrow streets, which could be noisier. GREAT BREAKFAST: We were pleasantly surprised at how wonderful the complementary 'continental breakfast' was. It included a selection of cereals, meats, great selection of fresh fruit, great coffee, juices, and great pastries. It is also served in a pleasant dining room. It seemed every complementary breakfast was standard, but I would check when making reservations. RESERVATIONS: We first heard of this hotel from Rick Steve's Italy travel guide. We booked the rooms directly through the hotel's website and got the 30 day pay in advance, non-cancellable rate which was a better rate than what we could find on the various other travel websites. We thought the hotel, while not inexpensive, was a great value. BOTTOM LINE: We would recommend this hotel but if you are looking for quiet, I would recommend that you check w the desk to see how noisy the Piazza is when Parliament is in session.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Definitely recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Katie1504
Reviews.Content: Excellent central location. Within walking distance of Colosseum, Vatican, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Pantheon and lots more! We stayed 5 nights for our honeymoon. Our room was upgraded which was huge and had an amazing view! All staff were wonderful and very happy to help. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel in an Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: delshorebird
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome. We were only in the city for a day and a half, but the location of the hotel was perfect for our 'whirlwind' tour with the Pantheon, Spanish Steps, and Trevi Fountain all within easy walking distance. The hotel was nicely appointed and exceptionally clean. The hotel staff was very professional and assisted us with all requests. Should we be fortunate enough to find ourselves back in Rome, we would definitely plan another stay at the Hotel Nazionale!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT CENTRAL LOCATION - QUALITY HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: treacleone2
Reviews.Content: This Hotel has an excellent location where you can walk to all the main attractions. We had a deluxe double room facing the parliament square, authentic Italian decor which one should expect when in Rome. A good continental breakfast with an additional bonus of a boiled egg machine which you adjust to your own preference. Staff throughout the hotel were very friendly and helpful and made us feel very welcome. Quality restaurants facing the Pantheon to be recommended. Wife`s recommendation to all fellow shoe fashion followers is to stick to flats as Roman cobbled streets are not heel friendly !!. My recommendation is make sure you have a full wallet as Rome can be very expensive, but in saying that I am saving up to go back there as soon as possible as it is a fantastic city.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant 4* Hotel in great Rome Location”
Reviews.Author: Gaynor B
Reviews.Content: Lovely Hotel, Traditianal Italian Palazzo style. Gorgeous old building beautifully restored and maintained. Great room (110) overlooking Piazza Montecitorio and the Lower Italian Parliament. Minutes from Via Corso - the Oxford Street of Rome. All attractions within easy walking distance for the nimble footed. Room had amazing high ceiling and very tasteful antique furniture. Very spacious for Rome. Big bathroom with lovely toiletries. Room was very clean and serviced regularly. Staff helpful and professional. Breakfasts were continental style and very plentiful with freshly baked pastries, cakes and bread rolls, delicious ham and cheese, cereals fruit yogurts- everything you could wish to keep you going on your morning sightseeing. Dinner was lovely on the one night we had a meal there - Maiallino (roast piglet) incredible - crispy skin on the outside, sweet succulent meat stuffed with ham and mushrooms on the inside - heavenly. Service a little slow towards the end of the meal but we were in no hurry - unlike another gentleman who must have waited an hour for his simple meal - not good! Perhaps another waiter on duty would have helped speed things up a little. All in all a very good experience and we would return here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location! Highly recommend.”
Reviews.Author: excitedtraveler46
Reviews.Content: Researched hotels for months and am so glad we ended up with this hotel. Have stayed at many 5 star hotels and was very happy here. It is located in the same pedestrian square as the Italian Parliament so it is super quiet and safe at night. Right around the corner from the best gelato - Giolitti and great shopping too. The hotel is very clean and beautiful. We had an executive room on the 5th floor facing the Parliament. Huge modern bathroom (for Europe standards) and a large room with a desk, two beds and sitting area. The front desk staff were wonderful. The concierge always gave good advice and directions. Extremely helpful. We paid in advance online for the non-refundable rate and got a great deal. The hotel is minutes from Pantheon, Piazza Navona and Campo di Fiori. On the other side, walking distance from Spanish Steps, Fontana di Trevi, etc. Prefer this location to hotels near Spanish Steps as at night you will want to be near the Piazzas. This is central to everything.

Reviews.Title: “"We loved it"”
Reviews.Author: MattHWrexham
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time researching a Hotel and I was not disappointed with the Nazionale. As already stated the Hotels location cannot be beaten. We had a Deluxe room(traditionally decorated & clean, lovely bathrooms) and it was very comfortable, although we were out most of the time it was nice to come back to a little luxury. The Hotel was very quiet and we slept well. The beds were also extremely comfortable. Breakfast was OK. Booked tickets for the Vatican Museum at the reception which saved us time queuing. Another tip, is to use the hotel Airport chauffeur service. We were picked up by a Luxury Mercedes and transferred to the Airport in less than 45 mins for 50 euros, it would of been a similar price if we had used a taxi and train but a the chauffeur was a lot less stress-full.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: rich0014
Reviews.Content: I am writing reviews for my entire trip to Italy and am being a hard critic. The Hotel Nazionale was perfect. Its location is perfect and convenient and walkable to all popular attractions, the room was spotless, the staff were very helpful, and it was an excellent value compared to nearby hotels. Breakfast did not knock my socks off but it was much appreciated at a cost of $0. Internet was pricey at 10 euro for 24 hours but that is probably my only issue.

Reviews.Title: “location,location,location”
Reviews.Author: ritzabitz
Reviews.Content: If you're considering where to stay in Rome with only a short time to do all the main sites, look no further than the Albergo Nazionale.You're a 1min walk to the Pantheon with lots of Gelato pit stops along the way! Giolotti, one of the busiest & most famous is around the corner to the left.Colosseum/Forum is about 15 mins away & Via del Corso, the main shopping strip is about 30 seconds! Vatican City is a nice 20 min walk.Lots of fabulous churches around too.Piazza Navona good for art,10mins.Piazza Farnese a real treat for food lovers & cheapest gifts i found in my 10 days here.Breakfast is more than you need with large range of fruit,cereals,breads,confectionary,meats,cheeses.Whilst i found one member of the front of house staff a bit abrupt on arrival, i had no problems otherwise & the level of accommodation is excellent.Double glazed windows mean you'll have a restful sleep.There's often protests around parliment sq but insist to the police you're staying here & they'll let you through.HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Location is perfect”
Reviews.Author: Bahamas23
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel, the staff were extremely helpful and accomodating, the rooms are very nice and a good size and clean, we had no problems at all. I am pretty fussy and would recommend this hotel anytime. The location is ideal, you can literally walk to all the main sites within a comfortable distance. There are plenty of lovely restaurants around the corner and the best gelato shop in Rome is on the side street. I would definitely stay here again and they deserve a higher rating on here.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: PerthTravelBugs76
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights and found it a very pleasant place to be! Staff friendly, rooms well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Position perfect”
Reviews.Author: Ajoz
Reviews.Content: Great location in Central Rome. We forgot to ask for non smoking room and ours had a smell of smoke for the first 2 days.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Roma; wonderfully comfortable and low-key. Very authentic.”
Reviews.Author: doppel
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful treat was the Nazionale. I'd booked it on the strong advice of a friend because of its 'authenticity, comfort, and divine location" but honestly we were blown away by how comfortable and special it was (and I have stayed in four and five star properties all over the world.) Nazionale is literally at ground-zero from everywhere you want to walk in Rome: two minutes to the Pantheon (we looked at this awesome 2000 year old building at least five times a day,) five to Piazza Navona, a few more minutes to Campo di Fiore and the Tiber; and in the other direction it was five minutes to the Trevi Fountain, another ten to the Spanish Steps and the Borghese Musei... I think the longest walk from the hotel might have been 30 minutes to the Vatican or Coloseum. Nazionale is on a quiet pedestrian square next to the Italian Parliament building, so it is very well-tended to and safe. The best gelato in Rome (Giolitti) is around the corner, and there are dozens of heavenly little trattorias, vias, and amazing churches all in the 'hood.' Now about the room. I was travelling with my grown daughter so we needed a 'twin' bedded room (hard to secure in Europe) and had reserved a 'twin classic". To my pleasant surprise we were upgraded to a 'twin executive' which according to the hotel's floorplan was one of two largest rooms in hotel. Gorgeous view over the piazza, comfortable beds and linens, spacious bathroom with huge jacuzzi tub, quiet, cool AC (a must in Rome.) The room was a fantastic refuge for late afternoon siesta every day after hours of sightseeing in the heat. The staff at the hotel was also most accommodating, arranging excursions, hotel reservations, airline check-ins, etc. Though the rooms are updated with modern comforts the whole feeling of the hotel is old-world Italian, very appealing and what we look for in travel (which is to say you knew you were not staying at a Mandarin Oriental or Four Seasons.) Only down notes: The coffee at the inclusivo breakfast (ample with plenty of choices) could have been better; the internet was 15 euro/day (I think it should be free at any four or more star establishment); and we couldn't check into our room until late in day of arrival, about three hours after promise (and we were very tired having taken a night flight from the east coast US.) But again we got the wonderful upgrade so couldn't complain too much. A perfect travel experience. My third time to Rome, and definitely my best. I would not hesitate booking Nazionale.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Igetarnd
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expectations. We had a wonderfully large and air conditioned room with a real mattress and spacious bathroom. After traipsing around Italy for 3 weeks, this room was a real treat. It was very comfortable and quiet. We finally had some TV channels in English (although the TV is difficult to use) and they have a ridiculously high fee for internet service. We loved everything else about the hotel and would recommend it to anyone. There are lots of restaurants in the area and you can simply walk out the door and stroll the streets to find dinner. So centrally located. We purchased Romapasses and made good use of the bus system, very convenient. We could be anywhere in town within 10 minutes. Most of central Rome is within a mile and can easily be walked if you prefer.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: EEBergman
Reviews.Content: A very nice and elegant hotel. The staff is very helpful, kind and provides you with the best service. It will be the fifth time we stay at the hotel since 2007! Nothing is missing at breakfast, they have everything. The rooms are very nice and very clean! The best place to live in Rom, close to everything of interest. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay, right in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: fiona037
Reviews.Content: Hotel Nazionale is well located in the city centre, near to main attractions such as the Pantheon, Piazza Navona, Piazza di Spagna,... But at the same time it offers its guests a quiet stay. The staff is very friendly and helpfull. Our room was spacious, in classic Italian style.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: JoaoAndrea
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Nazionale in Rome is a good hotel, with an excellent location. The Staff was friendly, the room was clean and the comfort was also good. It was 3 minutes walking form the pantheon, 1 minute from the Via del Corso and 8 minutes from Piazza Navona. The only negative aspects to note are the size of the double bed (quite small for two) and the breakfast, which could have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel in central Rome”
Reviews.Author: Hipha
Reviews.Content: I visited Rome in late March with my wife and young son. I researched hotels for many weeks and eventually selected the Nazionale mainly due to the good recent reviews on Trip Advisor. I selected a deluxe room for 3 nights and pre paid the total bill up front which offered a significant saving. We arrived at the hotel late evening and found that our room was everything we had hoped for with the sofa bed prepared for my son and the room in immaculate condition with a spacious modern bathroom and luxurious decoration. A slight disappointment was the room view which was of the rear of the building and not the Montecitorio square. However the positive side of this was that we had complete peace at night. Breakfast was buffet style and was very good and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Location is perfect with all attractions within walking distance. The Pantheon is on your doorstep as is the Trevi fountain and Spanish steps. We also walked to the coloseum and the vatican which were both incredible. There are plenty of local restaurants although we found quality to be variable. I also recommend the hotel transfer service which offers a private transfer at a very reasonable price. When we return to Rome we will look forward to staying at the Nazionale again.

Reviews.Title: “Location yes but for the businessman first and foremost”
Reviews.Author: 189852Traveler
Reviews.Content: I have over the years spent my time in Rome mostly in this hotel. I have accepted rooms in great need of renovation ( which has indeed been done over a period of time) for the location- safe, near to many things in central Rome and without street noice. But I must say that now, with recent experience, I think that in this price category, there are more value for money for a tourist to be found elsewhere. The front reception desk is cleary more interested in serving the businessman than the tourist and the same goes for the breakfast room. So thanks and good bye from me.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - it is worth every penny paid”
Reviews.Author: zouzouEst
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 days searching for a hotel in Rome. Finally I decided to go for this hotel taking into consideration that it has 5 points on trip adviser. I took an excellent executive room and it was ideal - large with high ceiling, very large bathroom with 2 sinks, Jacuzzi, bath and shower areas. Really beautiful room with nice view to the Piazza Montecetorio and Parliament view. Perfect location - we went walked out and when tiered we returned to our room had a rest then we continued our walk. Do not waste your time looking for another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, accommodating and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: prettylemming
Reviews.Content: Prior to staying here, my partner and I stayed at the UNA hotel, near the train station, which is also 4 stars. For that hotel the bathroom was gorgeous, but the room was tiny, I could not get out of the desk. Two nights later, we moved to this hotel because my dad and sister were joining us. So glad we moved, the staff here are so helpful. We got two double rooms which were huge compared to the double room in the UNA. We got the room on the 6th floor with the most amazing view of Rome. The staff there are just really helpful, the location was amazing, you are 3 minutes away from the Pantheon, Trevi fountain, etc. The place is a bit old, so you're not going to get the modern bathroom like UNA (the shower was amazing), but to be honest, I rather have helpful, nice accommodating staff (the showers here were fine and functional). My dad and sister stayed in one room the first night, and because of my dad's snoring, we had to move them to a room with a wall/door. They were more than accommodating, giving us a larger room at no extra charge, and moved our luggage there as well. Nothing to worry about on our end! I was also a bit late checking out, and while I was freaking out, they just waved it off and did not charge me. Wonderful experience, I would definitely come back to this hotel. Oh yes, they have a great taxi service to the airport (FCO). It was 50 euros for us, and for three people, that's actually cheaper than a taxi to the train station, and a train tickets for 3 to the airport. I would highly recommend - although maybe not for single travellers, we saw one of their single rooms, and they were a bit sad looking. We seriously saw every type of room possible in this hotel, and if you're two or three, highly recommend it. Breakfast is a bit lacklustre, but no complaints here.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel in Europe - will be back!!”
Reviews.Author: BeckyE2549
Reviews.Content: Traveling to Eastern Europe for a 2 week event that was canceled just hours before we boarded our flight abroad meant we to do some fast changing around of our schedule. When we decided to go to Rome (since we now had a wide open schedule) we knew the perfect place to stay..... My mother & I had stayed here 4 years prior when traveling Italy and this was our favorite hotel... Only problem for us was that it was 11pm, our flight had just landed in Rome, we couldn't find internet access at the airport, and we had no hotel reservation. We took a shuttle to Hotel Nazionale and they were so friendly and helpful when we arrived. Thank goodness they had availability... the front desk held our bags while we rushed around the corner to Giolottis for a gelato treat before going to our room. But it just kept getting better.... when we walked into our room, it was an executive suite! They had upgraded us and it was amazing. I was traveling with my mother and husband so the extra room priceless! Our room was very large, spotless, had a walk-in closet, huge bathroom... and every room had views of St Peters. It was heaven! The location couldn't be any better.... less than 5 minute walk to the Pantheon or Trevi Fountain.... worlds best gelato a minute walk from the hotel.... easy walking distance to the other main sights... the breakfast is delicious. it was exactly what we needed. I know I will be back to Rome someday.... and I won't even consider staying anywhere else. My mother said this is her all-time most favorite hotel she has ever stayed in. Thank you Hotel Nazionale!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, Great location!”
Reviews.Author: MissMandaMay
Reviews.Content: Great location - within walking distance to metro and major sites. Fantastic breakfast spread - best we had in all of Italy. Everything from fresh fruit to make your own smoothies, pastries galore, meats, cheeses, breads, cereal..... Great room - large, clean. Internet and all TV and movies for $15/day. Friendly staff - always attentive and helpful. Overall GREAT! Make sure you ask for a nonsmoking room. Will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location--friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: aidw0rker
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great and the staff were friendly and helpful. The room was tiny, not in great condition, and very cold. A fine place to stay for a couple of nights due to the location, but wouldn't want to spend extra time in the place.

Reviews.Title: “hard to imagine a better place to stay than the Nazionale”
Reviews.Author: 3_VA_Travelers_2010
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from our third stay at the Hotel Nazionale, we were again extremely pleased with the accommodations and service. The location of the hotel is ideal (central Rome) within easy walking distance (5-10 min) to the Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, or the Piazza Navona. Walking to the Coliseum or the Vatican is a bit farther, and will take about 20-30 minutes. A 2 min walk to Via del Corso and you will find stops for many bus routes (one euro/trip). With its central location, the hotel is ideal for shopping, restaurants and night life. We stayed in a recently renovated room facing the Italian Parliament and Piazza Montecitorio. The room was beautifully furnished with fine linens on the comfortable bed, large flat screen TV, and full sized, lovely tiled bathroom. The rooms are very quiet and since there is only pedestrian traffic around the hotel, we heard no street noise. The only exception was the garbage pickup that occurred around midnight. The area around the hotel is very safe, since the hotel faces Parliament’s Chamber of Deputies which is guarded 24 hours. The staff at the Nazionale Hotel are always friendly and helpful. When we requested help with the internet connection, they had someone to assist us in our room within 5 minutes. The breakfast staff went out of their way to provide us with an enjoyable start to our day. The front desk helped us with museum reservations and bus routes. Our special thanks to Humberto, Valentina and Nastasa for helping to ensure a most memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: madabouticecream
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel Nazionale at the end of August, so I don't think it was very busy. As we booked at the start of the year we got a decent rate (4nights for the price of 3 incl b/fast) for a hotel in a great location. It is a very short walk to Pantheon and Via Del Corso. Room was clean, confortable and roomy and the bathroom was a decent size (included a bath). We were on the top floor so a great view out of the window across to the Vatican City. The variety of food at breakfast was good. The staff were somewhat helpful, with them organising our visit to the Borghese Gallery but would not assist with our booking of the Vatican Museum (which we ended up doing ourselves at the internet cafe around the corner). Internet was expensive at the hotel, but the mini bar prices were reasonable due to it being August and they were having a special of everything being half-price. All in all, a good hotel for our first ever trip to Europe with Rome being our first stop, and I really do put this down to the location.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, Beautiful Hotel at a great rate!”
Reviews.Author: Sal_711
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location, staff are wonderful and very helpful! Great Gelato bar just around the corner. Safe as houses as the hotel is next door to the police headquarters. Sometimes the concierge service let us down, not knowing that there was an internet cafe around 200m away and also not knowing that you could book tickets to the Vatican Museum the day before to skip the line.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 4 stars with air-conditioning issues in early October”
Reviews.Author: JChua
Reviews.Content: Unlike other popular Italian cites like Venice and Florence, it was not an easy task finding the right Hotel in Rome that offers our top criterion for a good hotel stay - Central Location, Quiet for a good night's sleep & Italian charm. And of course, for people like us who are from the Tropics, air-conditioning was of utmost importance to us. Having cancelled a nearby Hotel in order to stay at this Hotel Nazionale last minute, we thought the Hotel oozes much more Italian charm. Whenever we are in Italy, I will try to stay in classically designed Hotels. And from the reviews here, rooms were reportedly more spacious, and I am glad to say that rooms are indeed bigger here; common areas are also classically beautiful! Took a cab from the Termini and arrived at Via del Corso's Palazzo Chigi (the PM's office) and the Hotel Nazionale was easy to find - just cross the road and walk straight on! Having requested a higher floor room facing the Hotel's back, we were shown to a 4th floor Executive room, facing other houses' roof tops and courtyards. A glimpse of St Peter's was in the distance. Not facing any roads or the Piazza Monte Citorio, the room was indeed very quiet for a good night's sleep. Our room was indeed very spacious, it is certainly the size of a suite by any Itatian city's standards - right beside the comfy bed was a closet room, a dressing table within a wall niche (nice for putting on make-up!) and a spacious bathroom with jacuzzi tub and shower. Separated by a door to the bedroom was a nice walk-in area and sitting room with 3 seater sofa bed, dinning table, coffee table, armchair and an office table. Though everything in the room was not brand new, everything worked and there was sufficient lighting for reading. Toiletries including body lotion and a safe were available. There were 2 TVs with English channels, good for catching up with news happening around the Globe. Breakfast choice was the widest among the 6 hotels in this trip, enabling us to enjoy something different during our 2 nights stay - perfectto! Location wise, this Hotel is also very centrally located - 5 minutes to the Trevi and Piazza Navona, 10 minutes to the Spanish Steps for branded shopping and Il Vittoriale for the Capitoline Museums etc. But the closest supermarket we could find was at Forno's, a shop right beside the Trevi, 5 minutes away. Maybe there were other closer shops around the Hotel to buy drinks and fruits, but we did not come across any during our stay? All Reception staff that we had come into contact with was knowledgeable, kind and helpful. Special mention must be made of Sig. Yanni, who had gone out of his way to help converse with the owner of a handicraft shop in Spoleto, to help to send our purchased items to the Hotel. Grazie mille, Yanni, we cannot thank you enough! So, after all the praises, why still the 4 star ratings … Frankly, if not for the air-conditioning issue, we could have given this Hotel a 6 stars ratings if we were allowed to do so. Yes, from beginning to the end, we were so pleased with this Hotel that my husband had said that after numerous trips to the Eternal City, this was the Hotel in Rome that we should be returning to and I fully concur with him. Our stay was at the beginning of the autumn season. In the day, I could still see ladies walking around in T-shirts, sleeveless blouses, baring their cleavages and sweating. Night time temperature was still around 20 or 21 (note: Rome is not like the Umbrian cities which were already experiencing 10-15 degrees during the nights due to their hill-top elevated position). Much to our surprise, on the night of 3rd October, from 6pm onwards, air-conditioning was switched off for all rooms. A check with the Receptionists had confirmed my most feared - that the Hotel didn't think air-conditioning was necessary, and so switches it off. We then requested and received a huge fan, which blows no air - this still puzzles me at this point? Needless to say, we open all windows but I still didn't sleep well that night. The next night, I asked again, and this time, received a much smaller fan that actually worked! And with this smaller fan, I had slept much better, in preparation for a 13 hour flight home the next day. During our stay, I had also seen porters sending fans to the other rooms, so we weren't the only ones who complain about the lack of air-conditioning. In our honest opinion, the Hotel should have waited till mid October, or for the temperatures to fall below 15 degree C, before turning off the air-conditioning. Needless to say, this air-conditioning thingy will keep us from coming back to this Hotel at least during the 'border' months of October, March and April. So if air-conditioning is important to you, my advice would be to double check before you book. Notwithstanding the air-conditioning issue, I thought we had enjoyed our stay very much at this well located and well managed Hotel. We thought it should have enjoyed a much higher rating. The price and quality ratio is really quite high here but to us, rooms must be air-conditioned unless you are talking about the period from November to mid March. Enjoy this bella & comfortable Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: llanfra
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location very close to all the most beautiful attractions of Rome. It has an excellent breakfast and the executive room is very spacious. This hotel is in a square, Montecitorio, every day, this square is closed at the end of the day and open in the morning. Every morning, 7PM the removal of the "iron pipes is very noisy, and it really makes you wake up. I also had a problem with internet connection in my room and the hotel staff could not solve it. Even with the noise in the morning, I come back to stay in this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Charming family owned hotel right in the centre of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Tilf
Reviews.Content: This is a really great place to stay in Rome. It is right in the pedestrianised centre, so you have a very short walk to the Pantheon, Trevi Fountain etc and most importantly no traffic noise. Giolitti, the famous ice cream shop, is just around the corner. Our room was a little dated but we did not see this to be an issue - we were busy looking at the dome of the Pantheon from our bathroom window, and over the parliament square from the sitting room window! The old style bar and sitting area downstairs is very charming, with marble columns and statues. There was a juicing machine at breakfast which was pretty cool. The staff were extremely helpful and fluent in several languages. Our little baby was welcomed, and they gave us a big bowl to sterilise her bottles in and boiled water for her milk. We have stayed at the Nazionale 3 times now, and will continue to stay here every time we visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Who gave this hotel 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: Perthi
Reviews.Content: The reason for a Poor rating is because this is supposed to be a 4 stars hotel and we paid 4 stars price for the room. We travel frequently and only stay in 4 and 5 stars hotels and Albergo Nazionale is not one of them. Let's start with the positive comments first: location, location, location; perfectly placed to see Rome. We had room 409 with a view of the piazza; the content of the breakfast was good although you have to pay if you want hot breakfast and you have to get your own drinks and toast. NEGATIVES: The reception staff are not friendly at all; we had problems with the shower and despite asking them to do something about it; they ignore it completely. The water pressure of the shower was extremely feeble to say the least and there was mould on the walls and ceiling of the bathroom. The breakfast room is a dark and boring cellar with dark wood and no imagination whatsoever so an italian interior decorator is urgently needed. The whole place is dated and needs a lot of attention but I doubt that things will improve.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for central Rome”
Reviews.Author: Horseman
Reviews.Content: Dead impressed with this hotel - in a fabulous location, tucked away by the Italian parliament building. Room a little faded, but it added to the character if anything. The hotel's staff are first-rate; breakfast was good (it's not acres of buffet that you'd never eat anything from - but who needs that everytime). A real quality and value choice if you're going to Rome as a tourist (walkable to Pantheon, Piazza Novena etc). I couldn't speak of it too highly !

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ELA81
Reviews.Content: It the best, very friendly and polite staff. Breakfast is great, beds are very comfortable. The location is perfect. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: CJUWiltshire
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in a perfect location and the views from the rooms out onto the square are just wonderful. In the centre of Rome but away from the bussle / noise. A few minutes walk to the Pantheon and lots of lovely restaurants nearby. The staff were lovely and very helpful. Some of the rooms are a bit tired but this just doesn't matter. Our room was very large. Bathroom was lovely. Breakfast was good too. A very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location, great rooms, but aloof staff”
Reviews.Author: curiousjayu
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here on a trip to Rome. I spent a lot of time trying to find a hotel that was not insanely expensive but also in a good location. We were willing to spend some extra money to get a nice spacious room for our visit to Rome. I ended up booking a room at this Hotel, using their online booking system. I booked an executive room and got a discount for pre-paying. This was my first visit to Rome. The location of the hotel is outstanding. You are just a few minutes from the Pantheon, and can walk to the major piazzas, Trevi fountain, shopping, etc. It's also right around the corner (literally) from the famous Giolotti gelateria. And a short cab ride from the train station (Rome - Termini) or the Vatican. The Piazza de Montecitorio itself is fairly quiet. As some of the other reviewers have written, there is some garbage truck noise at night and also occasional protests in the piazza. But for us these were not an issue. The room we had was beautiful - very high ceilings, windows overlooking the piazza, beautiful furnishings, great A/C, and a large bathroom with a tub. My main complaint about this hotel is the staff. When we arrived the gentleman at the reception did not even crack a smile and barely made eye contact. In general the staff do not go out of their way to make you feel welcome or be friendly. That said, if you ask questions or ask for assistance, they will respond. But don't expect any warm and fuzzy treatment. Overall this was fine for us since we are independent travelers and had a full schedule. But it did detract from our experience somewhat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location With Big Rooms”
Reviews.Author: wbt81
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for the first two nights of our trip to Italy. We chose the hotel for its location and were not disappointed, it was close to most of the major sites, the farthest being a 15-20 minute walk from the Vatican. Area felt very safe since it is next the parliament building. Our room was very large with an extra sitting area and second TV which was overkill for what we needed, but still very nice for repacking when we left. Only downside was that, like a lot of things in Rome, it was not especially close to a metro stop so took us a little while to walk from the closest stop with our bags. Would suggest checking the hotels website if you are looking to book a few weeks in advance as that is where we found a great last minute rate.

Reviews.Title: “The Nazionale - for peace and quiet!”
Reviews.Author: cap25
Reviews.Content: I can only add to the other positive reviews about the Hotel Nazionale . Yes, I agree the hotel is elegant, well staffed and nicely appointed, but the main selling point - and it is an important one - is that the location removes you from the craziness of Rome traffic, congestion and noise and offers a refuge to return to every evening. This is no small matter in a city over-run with people and vehicles. In the middle of the night, I loved looking down at the well-lit piazza and seeing nothing but impressive buildings and one lone policeman standing guard. (Indeed, the hotel is within walking distance of most of the tourist sights, but don't forget the lesser known but remarkable Galleria Doria Pamphili just down the street- be sure to get the audio guide!)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: HeatherERRN
Reviews.Content: This was the greatest find in Rome. It is in the best location to everything. Situated in the Piazza Montecitorio. The Italian Parliment is also located there. Making it a very quiet and safe area. There isn't vehicles allowed in the piazza, and the government building is guarded by their military. This is right in the heart of Rome. You are only 2 blocks from the Pantheon, the Trevi Fountain, and only about 15 minutes to the Vatican and the Coloseum. We walked everywhere!!! We checked in at 0830 and had a room ready for us. A very quaint room with a little sitting area by the window. I believe that this is considered a 4 star hotel. There is a nice little bar that we actualy had a drink at. Did not eat here, so no feedback on the food. There is a wonderful bakery/gelato shop just right around the corner of the building with amazing treats. The staff was so wonderful at helping us with everything. There is a small lift which most places don't have. I cannot stress how quiet are stay was. I found a really good deal when I booked, 230 Euros a night. Most of the other sites were in the 400 range. If you can get anything close to what I did, I would book here in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Very Quiet- Great Staff, Location, Food - Famous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: freddakiko
Reviews.Content: This is the third time we stay here. Rooms are clean and the food was great, especially the breakfast that had everything. You could even boil your own eggs and make your own smoothie with a juicer. They helped my kids know how to use the equipment. The rooms were very quiet. In fact I have been to other hotels in Rome that are noisier. No regular traffic is allowed on the Montecitorio square in front. It was quiet and the view fantastic. Near to all Roman sites. The staff were great and they helped me promptly with luggage and taxi as I had to go to the Termini train station to go up to Parma. In fact they even helped me check the trains because the snow fall up north was causing a lot of train delays. I could give those guys and "abbraccio". This hotel is also famous because it was where the Griswalds stayed in the movie "National Lampoons European Vacation". A hilarious funny movie set in 1985 about an American family travelling through Europe. Main event scenes took place in and around the Hotel Nazionale. Look at the pics I speak the truth...

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Nazionale excellent shame about the noise”
Reviews.Author: oztravellerLeeds
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from 3 nights at the Hotel Nazionale for our wedding aniversary, after it was recommended to us, it is a lovely old building in an excellent location for all the main interests in Rome, we were upgraded to an executive room free of charge, room 110 which is on the first floor just above the entrance, the room was excellent clean and imposing the bathroom was large and again excellent, the problem we had was that one of the windows did not appear to close correctly and on each night we were ther we were woken at 2am ish by a truck coming into the square to empty some form of bin for glass, which woke us up, any noise in the square we could hear and so had 3 sleepless nights, the reception were told about this but did nothing. This aside the hotel was excellent and clean mostly the staff were attentive and helpfull except for the window and they did appear to lose interest in us on our last night there, when we checked out and settled the bill we were not even asked if we had enjoyed our stay, which I felt was unusual.. I would consider staying at this hotel again but maybe we were just unlucky with the room

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay for Rome novices”
Reviews.Author: Modern_Phrenologist
Reviews.Content: I'm sure this is not the best hotel in Rome but it has several things to recommend it. Its central location can't be beat. It is a five minute walk from the Pantheon, the Trevi fountain and Piazza Navonna. Second, the desk staff is excellent. They are multilingual and will take time to help you with requests.. They did everything we asked of them and provided useful information to make our stay more pleasant. Third, the breakfast is substantial, if a bit boring because it does not change regularly. Also, while guests can make their own boiled eggs the hotel charges 10 euros for scrambled or fried eggs--that is a bit odd but I guess gthey do not want to bother with 'special' orders. Fourth, one can get a really good deal on one's room rate by booking and paying early. We got 30% off the standard rate which is not inconsequential. On the negative side, the hotel is in a very old building which needs work and the decor and fit and finish of the rooms needs improvemet. Everything looks its age.
