Perhaps an upgrade is in the works. They are dong some work on the outside of the building. Perhaps they will tackle the inside next. One other complaint--they charge 15 euros a day for in-room internet access. Why? All in all an excellent place to stay in Rome for most people.

Reviews.Title: “loved the nazionale”
Reviews.Author: z235e49
Reviews.Content: spent 2 nites at the nazionale the other day- had a great time. the room was huge and very nicel decorated. we had a tile floor and nice area rugs. the bathroom was also huge. the staff was personable and helpful. the location was perfect- right off of corso, near the piazza colonna and a short walk to the pantheon, spanish steps, piazza navona and more. the only negative was that the showerhead was too low- and i am only 5'9.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: MT_frequent_traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a week in September. Hotel is in a perfect location, close to great restaurants (including the best gelato!), Trevi fountain and all of the sites in ancient Rome. Even the Vatican was within walking distance. Rooms are clean and spacious, with comfortable classic furniture. Our room was very large, with a large upgraded bathroom. Staff is courteous and helpful, and our room was thoroughly cleaned each day. Only caveat with its location -- being next to Parliament means small protests or political rallies. We were awakened every morning by the same protestor, issuing the same speech to no one in particular.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Kiran1
Reviews.Content: we stayed over 1 night at this B&B as we were going to france early morning. The owner - Julia is lovely, rooms were comfortable and clean, breakfast was great.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in an amazing location in the heart of rome”
Reviews.Author: edtrem
Reviews.Content: nice hotel in an amazing location in the heart of rome. room & furnishings were not "modern" but were very nice & plush. the hotel is about a 5 minute walk to the pantheon & trevi fountain. check the hotel's web site for great deals for booking direct with them. staff were super friendly and helpfull. the breakfast included with the room was great. I would stay their again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Melovetravel99
Reviews.Content: The best location, great service and the most spacious room I have ever stayed in while in Europe. The breakfast was nice too. Quick walk to the Vatican, Spanish Steps, Forum, Pantheon, Piazza Navone, and there was a fabulous Gelateria around the corner. Will definately stay here next year when we return to Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel-- great location”
Reviews.Author: Knickster
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Rome for 3 nights and had 2 rooms. The hotel upgraded us to two adjoining rooms which were exceptionally large and well appointed. The bathroom was beautiful with a jacuzzi tub and shower. Rooms and entire hotel clean and welcoming. The location was excellent with easy walking to many sites. Especially close to the Pantheon and located in a very safe area near government buildings. Also right around the corner from the best gelato in Rome. Hotel staff great and they recommended two excellent restaurants. -- Ristorante Checco er Carettiere and Ristorante L'Angoletto. Only negative to the room was that you couldn't lower the heat in the rooms which were too hot. Front desk explained that the hotel controls the overall heat but we could open our windows which helped a lot. Would definitely stay here again when we return to Rome, but were spoiled by the rooms they upgraded us too. Check out their website for specials depending on the time of the year-- we were able to get a discount but November is a slow time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, not the most recent one but really comfortable”
Reviews.Author: DAMR
Reviews.Content: Very classic yet functional hotel. one might find the decoration a bit old fashion, but this hotel is really comfortable, the staff is top level (and could speak at least three languages), and the location is just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: SwissSpaceBoy
Reviews.Content: We have spent one week in November 2008 to visit Rome. This hotel is very good located beside the Italian government. You can ask to have a room with a view on this piazza. Very quiet. You can even visit the Trevi fountain every night if you want ! We stayed in room 207 that is a superior room. Very spacious, big and new bathroom, 1 queen size bed, 1 big flat screen, free safe, minibar, airco, Internet services, .... We were missing some heating as it was still very warm outside for the time of the year. But on our request, they added a mobile heater in the room that was just perfect to heat the room in the evening. Breakfast is very good cf. Italian standards. I think the hotel has no parking space however but you should avoid using your car in Rome anyway. The price is rather high but you are very good located and the staff is very helpful. This hotel is also a lot visited by government people so this should be a guarantee for its quality. PS : 50m behind the hotel is the Gelateria Giolotti, one of the best Italian icemakers of Rome. Just perfect !

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: BDGALL
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Nazionale for 4 nights in July to celebrate our 1st wedding anniversary. The hotel is located on a lovely pedestrianised area (therefore quiet!!) within very easy walking distance of many major sites. Check-in was quick and efficient and the lobby/bar area beautifully 'Italian'. Our room was relatively large with a small reception area and large bathroom with an excellent shower. We did have a problem with our room safe which was fixed in minutes by the in-house engineers. We found the area around the hotel very safe and full of excellent restaurants (explore the side streets for the best ones). The Nazionale is an excellent hotel which we would definitely return to on our next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: anes69
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights post cruise. Booked directly with hotel and Roberta was excellent to work with. Answered all questions promptly and assisted us with all of our plans. Location is excellent as stated in other reviews. Would not stay anywhere else in Rome!! Perfect for teenagers with the family and we walked to the Vatican everyday and also to the Colessium. Highly recommend staying at this fine hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: lauracohenromano
Reviews.Content: It's been a few years since we were there but I wanted to put this review with my current TripAdvisor id.... We echo what all the other reviewers here have said...this hotel could not have been more perfectly located - we walked everywhere, from the Pantheon a 2 minute walk away to the Colosseum about 15 to 20 minutes, and too many other locations to mention. The room was spacious, all staff were very helpful (one even helped my now-fiancee be sure he had the correct words to ask my hand in marriage in Italian!) We booked our trip with Go-Today so this hotel was an upgrade in their package - and well worth it! Can't imagine what it would have been like to pay less but be at a hotel not as nice or central - it's the walking everywhere that really made the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: familyboo
Reviews.Content: THIS HOTEL IS IN A GREAT LOCATION IN THE CENTRE OF ROME IN A PEDESTRIANISED AREA. WITHIN EASY WALKING DISTANCE OF ALL THE MAIN ATTRACTIONS. WE DROVE INTO THE CENTRE OF ROME AND PARKED IN A PUBLIC CAR PARK (WHICH WAS SURPRISINGLY WELL PRICED). FROM THERE WE COULD HAVE WALKED BUT WITH 3 KIDS IN TOW WE TOOK A TAXI. When we arrived the porter was lovely and entertained the children while we checked in. Then up in a small lift we found our comfortable rooms (no views). They were lovely and spacious and the sofa beds were converted into kids beds. A modern bathroom with complimentary shampoos etc. As it is pedestrianised it was safe for the kids to have a run around outside. The breakfast is good with lots of choice, if you need an espresso they will get you one if you ask. There are plenty of eateries nearby and the ice ceams are wonderfully yummy! Be careful though! We got caught out big time in the Vatican City, 6 sandwiches 2 bowls of chips and 6 drinks, £80. If you go away from the main streets you can reduce this by £20 and have 8 pizzas, 2 salads and drinks with wine in lovely restaurants. Same goes for coffee, 7euros in the squares 1 euro down the side streets. Rome is lovely, an ideal city with children as everything is close by and the Roman history fascinates them. If they lose interest, get 'em an ice cream!! Beware though some site including the cistine chapel close at 4pm. We missed it boo hoo....

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful ROME”
Reviews.Author: Peter A
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in Rome and Hotel Nazionale was a perfect home base. Great room, very clean and an ideal location to explore Rome from. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Still the best”
Reviews.Author: gleason
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Nazionale in March 2006 in room 215 overlooking the traffic free parliament square.The breakfast and service was great and after our visit last week I can confirm nothing has changed. We emailed before we arrived and requested room 215 and it was no problem.They welcomed us like regular visitors,very refreshing for a large tourist hotel. The hotel itself is old,stylish and very Italian. We booked through CITALIA.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: picologallese
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, friendly staff, clean & tidy, good selection at breakfast. Everything you could ask for in a city center hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Holmeschapel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just spent 5 nights in this hotel. Found it easy to book on line and got an upgrade to a deluxe room which was big and comfortable. Very clean but the fittings in the bathroom are looking tired and it took an age to fill the bath! Good breakfast with plenty of choice. Nothing cooked but you could boil an egg in the egg timer provided. One complaint was the coffee. It came from a machine labelled "Nescafe". It was supposed to be genuine " Americano" or whatever. It was not like any Italian coffee either of us had tasted before. There is another machine for nescafe which we did not try. The lift needs replacing and one lift for a biggish hotel is just not enough. At peak times the wait for the lift was so bad we walked to our room and we were on the third floor! This hotel is on one of Rome's great squares- Piazza Montecitorio. Traffic free and only 200 meters from Via del Corso. As it is traffic free the nights are fairly quiet but be aware of the dustbin removals at 1am. Would we return? Certainly. The location of the hotel justifies that alone

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location and service”
Reviews.Author: Corky12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights before our Med cruise in May. We loved it. The location is great- within walking distance of all the sites. The only time we took a taxi was to the Vatican because we had an early tour. We did walk back though. It wasn't as quiet as we thought it would be. We were in the front of the building and one night there was some kind of a protest going on at 11PM. Also they emptied the trash cans early every morning. But such is the charm of Rome ( we did sleep with the window open). The room was very small but had a great bathroom. The breakfast is very good- the best orange juice I ever had! The staff is very helpful and friendly. They made telephone calls for us without us even asking! We will stay here again and recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: european-traveler101
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights the second week of August, 2007. The location is great, very safe with police stationed at the four corners of the piazza (this is where the italian parliament is located). Gioletti (the best ice cream in Rome) is next door. Trevi, Pantheon, Piazza Navone are all within 10 minutes walking or less. The room was big and clean. There was work going on the italian parliament building so it was a bit noisy in the early morning but not too bad as the double windows were very efficient at cutting noise. The AC was strong (we had to turnit off at night). The continetal breakfast (buffet) was nice . Wired internet access is 10 euros a day. No wireless in room. We defintitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Travelgirl1969
Reviews.Content: The Nazionale is a good standard, traditional hotel in a central location. We travelled with Citalia Holidays, who offer a 24 hours a day concierge service which is fab if you need them for anything. Our concierge, Leonie, called by phone to check all was ok and if she could be of assistance. I would definately reccommend this hotel, the location is superb and the hotel is just right for a short city break. Good air con and bathroom has a powerful shower. Breakfast ample to set the day off to a good start. The sights are all within walking distance and with the use of a good map given to us by the hotel, we did it all on foot! Distances in reality werent far and most of the streets are cobbled and have little or no traffic. A lot of the streets are shady as the buildings are so high they block the sun. We walked happily with a 6 year old for 4 days in 100* heat through piazza after piazza. We spent most of our money on cold drinks so dont go in August if you dont like it hot. Some of the food and drink in the toursit areas like Piazza Navona and near the Vatican were NOT value for money. The food wasnt good and cost a lot! We dont mind what we pay if its a good standard, so choose wisely especially if you are only there a few days. We loved the whole atmosphere of Rome and felt comfortable there. Its so amazing to see the size of the buildings in ancient Rome and the Vatican area is really something to see aswell! Even with a child, if you explain what you are looking at and paint pictures theres no reason why they cant enjoy seeing the sights as much as you do!

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it”
Reviews.Author: AndyBirmingham_uk
Reviews.Content: Just come back from the hotel nazionale in Rome, brilliant location for all the major tourist attractions, the staff were all excellent and helpful, the breakfast was top notch (we only did b&B), the room fantastic, would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Charm”
Reviews.Author: Busterkitty
Reviews.Content: Not happy with the hotel we booked from home ! I had been in Rome at least 20 times so we got back into our car, we knew this hotel had a great rep. we called they offered a great room for a really great price. We got there 30 min. latter and we were in our room in ten minutes . The only problem was it was hard to find the little ally you need to drive into the front of the building. This hotel has old world charm with very kind people working for them. THe entire time was great, the car was parked for us and there every time we needed it. THe food at the hotel was very good both in the morning and in their dinning room. Alfanso at the front desk was very very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable stay!”
Reviews.Author: macmillannurse
Reviews.Content: This is a very traditional hotel with large rooms overlooking the roof tops of Rome (if you're very lucky!). Ours certainly did with a double window looking out towards St Peter's Basilica - beautiful at night. Outside there is a seating area looking onto the square. We were celebrating my husband's 60th and had a complimentary bottle of bubbly provided by the tour company. I made a last minute request for this just as the bar was closing on the eve of his birthday at 11.45pm. This did not prove a problem and the bar staff even took photographs for us. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel. Italian people are fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: Kathi75
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, convenient to walk anywhere, and very quiet. The breakfast is outstanding - lots more selection than continental breakfasts we've had in other hotels. Our room was big and quiet at night. The bathroom/shower were good. The staff is friendly and helpful. I'd recommend this to anyone staying in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: bhsTulsa
Reviews.Content: We used Virgin Vacations and got a great 7 night deal. The hotel is a 5 min. walk to the Trevi Fountain and 5 mins to the Pantheon. It was perfect for the 2 of us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rhorbacker
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this hotel March 14-22. This hotel was definately above average compared to other European hotels I stayed at. The most impressive amenity was the American type breakfast, which was plentiful for all of us. All of the employees we encountered were able to speak English. We began each day with early tours, so the breakfast was super convenient. My family was in ages 48-77 and we were all able to walk to the Collisum , Vatican, and other tourist attractions. The Pantheon and Trevi Fountain were very close walking distance. We needed some assistance on making telephone calls in Rome, and the hotel immediately offered to make the calls for us, and at no charge. Depending upon what part of Rome a taxi is coming from, some of them were unable to drop us off at our door, and instead about 200 feet away. It worked out fine for us. The hotel had a nice separate meeting area for several families to meet inside the hotel, and also several chairs outside, to just enjoy the open air. Cafes and a market were within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frank88
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the middle of Rome - easy walking distance to the Pantheon, Vatican, Forum, Spanish Steps. The staff was friendly and helpful. We didn't need much help from them but they were happy to make reservations for us when needed. The room was above average - clean and comfortable. Our five day stay included a daily continental breakfast. They offered rolls, sliced meat, hard or soft boiled eggs, yogurt, fresh fruit and, of course, wonderful coffee. I wouldn't hesitate to stay there next time we visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: chriscook7
Reviews.Content: Me and my Girlfriend stayed here for 3 nights mid december and thought it was a really nice hotel. The rooms and bathroom are massive and the staff were very friendly. The main reason we chose this hotel was its location. its perfect right in the centre of rome and within easy walking ditance of the Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps. i would fully recommend this hotel as a excellent base to see the sights !!!

Reviews.Title: “Be very,very careful”
Reviews.Author: Romanaccio
Reviews.Content: This dysfunctional hotel is a reminder of Rome 40 years ago. They boast of air conditioning throughout but turn it off at their whim to save money - including every night at 2AM, so get ready to wake up in a sweat every night. Their idea of service is to argue that you don't need whatever it is you need. One detail: during a five-day stay my drinking glass was not once cleaned or replaced. The gas traps in the bathroom plumbing were not functioning properly (common Italian plumbing problem) and so the bathroom reeked permanently of sewer smells. Fun eh? I've read some good reviews here, and the location is undoubtedly great, but if you don't want a lot of old-fashioned aggravation search elsewhere. Regards.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: luvtobeonvaca
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay here for three nights in October. We had two rooms which were adjoining overlooking the Vatican on the top floor. The hotel staff was very helpful. We wanted to take the shower home with us it was that good. The location of the hotel was perfect. We never used the metro or taxis during our stay, we walked everywhere. At night, there were plenty of good restaurants within a few steps of the hotel. After dinner, you could easily walk to Piazza Navona or Trevi fountain. Would defnitely stay again our next visit in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, but old-fashioned room”
Reviews.Author: dipsy_9001
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 4 nights. The hotel is very well located for tourists, and a few steps away from major attractions (pantheon, trevi fountain, piazza Navona,...). Staff is helpful, breakfast is OK. The room was a bit old-fashioned, especially the bathroom which doesn't deserve 4*.

Reviews.Title: “A really pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: derosa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for a weekend break a few days ago having read the reviews on Tripadvisor. We loved it. We travel extensively in Italy but were really being quite selective about where we stayed in Rome as we wanted a superior type of hotel without being in something overly extravagant. Equally we wanted to be away from traffic noise and stay somewhere with character. This hotel fitted our wishes. The hotel is, as many have commented, so well situated it is hard to imagine anywhere better. It is very central and it is amazing how quickly you can walk anywhere. The staff were helpful, the rooms were spotlessly clean and the shower was good - which is often not the case. The breakfast buffet was also very good. The hotel is situated on a beautiful, quiet piazza with numerous good restaurants in the area. I note the comment about access to the piazza. This is because your are near the government buildings and so the area is protected by police but taxi drivers seemed to be allowed through if they just told the police in the area they were headed for Hotel Nazionale. In any case the hotel offers you a limo service from the airport. It was 70 Euros whereas a taxi might have been say 40 odd euros but it was nice to be met at the airport and whisked stright through to the hotel without any hassle. Incidentally the limo driver offered to take us to the Systine Chapel the day after our arrival with "no queues"! We were a bit sceptical but he collected us on time and for an extra payment of 40 Euros he whisked us straight into the Vatican through the exit, paying some guards it seems (!) and straight into the very front of the building - the queues outside stretched literally for miles and it was the best 40 Euros we have ever spent - we felt a bit guilty but hey this was Rome! Clearly this is not unusual as the guards just viewed it as routine. A great hotel - not cheap - but if you can afford the rates - which are not extravagant - I think you will enjoy your stay and leave feeling happy that you booked. The ice cream parlour around the corner was.........great!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. Our family of 6 (4 adults aged 36-58 years old, a 4 year old and a 15 month old) just got back from a week-long stay at this hotel. We had 2 rooms on the third floor (fourth floor to us Americans) and both rooms were spacious and lovely. Room 306 faced the Piazza Colonna/Parliament, had a sofa, upholstered chair, coffee table, queen-sized bed, a regular sized bathroom and room for a cot for an infant. Room 302 faced the back of the hotel, had a desk and chair, two upholstered chairs, twin beds, a roll away bed and a big bathroom (with a nice size soaking tub). If you are familiar with Italian hotel rankings, this hotel is definitely a 4 star hotel. All the staff we interacted with were helpful, friendly and accommodating. The breakfast buffet was good and offered something for everyone. The front desk staff made excellent recommendations for local restaurants and were able to provide directions to places nearby. The location of this hotel is top notch! Most of the major sites are within walking distance. Pushing two strollers, we walked to The Coliseum, The Vatican, Piazza Navona, the Pantheon, Campo D'Fiori, and the zoo (northern part of Villa Borghese). TIPS: 1. The hotel is located on a pedistrian only piazza next to Parliament and it seemed that the piazza has car restrictions at certain times of the day. We never figured out the "rules" but it looked like only cars with permission were allowed on the piazza between the hours of 8:00am and 5:00pm. Arriving from the airport, we found out the hard way that our car service could not drop us off in front of the hotel. The driver let us off at a side street and we had to drag our luggage (and strollers) around the perimeter of the piazza until we found a way accessible to wheeled luggage and strollers. 2. The hotel has a laptop in the lobby available for guest use...but charges 5 euros for 30 minutes! We found an internet cafe near the entrance of the Vatican Museum that charged 8 euros for 5 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, not as quiet as we had hoped, needs some updating”
Reviews.Author: azogal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Nazionale for 4 nights in mid-March 2006. And had a bit of a mixed experience. On the one hand, the rooms were clean and the location was great to walk to just about any place in Central Rome (and every place else was about under 10 euro cab ride). Based on the breakfast room crowd, most of the other guests seemed to be older European couples and men in suits. Positives: --We arrived 3 hours earlier than I had said and our room was ready. --The lobby is beautiful --Breakfast was bountiful (I loved the little machine that made soft-boiled eggs) --Room was clean --Area felt safe and many things were within easy walking distance. --Staff was friendly and helpful finding information for me and calling restaurants and arranging a private driver to the airport (50 euro) --Rooms were warm (we had unseasonably cold weather)and included safe, mini bar, 2 TV's, hair dryer Negatives: --The shutters on the windows made the rooms dark --Bathroom was a bit out of date with mixed water temperature and weak water pressure --I did not receive a reply to my 2 e-mails confirming our reservation --While the hotel is on a pedestrian only square is was still noisy at night. The hotel is around the corner from the famous Giolitti gelato and, I assume that we were hearing groups of shouting tourists and teens leaving Giolitti until it closed. Also, the Parliament is being renovated so we were woken every night about 1:30 AM by heavy equipment that seemed to be picking up trash or delivering new construction materials. This might be a good reason to have a room on the back of the hotel. --When we checked in, the previous guest had left the safe door closed and locked which we reported to the front desk. They said they would send someone up to take care of it, but no one came that night. In their defense, it was Sunday night and when we mentioned it again in the morning on our way to breakfast it was taken care of right away.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: jane00
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property during the holiday season and loved it. Hotel staff was very accommodating, rooms were a good size and breakfasts yummy. Located minutes from all important sites. J. Reid

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: whystayhome
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in mid-December. The location is terrific and the staff were pleasant and accommodating. The room is adequate [ours had a view of St. Peter's]. The bathroom is fine, and included shower robes. Breakfast was very good. If you understand that this is not a luxury hotel, you will be very satisfied with your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Weekend Special”
Reviews.Author: tghiemstra
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel using reviews from Trip Advisor and Rick Steves' "Rome"...if you can get the 3 for 2 weekend special, it's well worth the price. Great location, friendly and helpful staff, wonderful (bountiful) breakfast, and beautiful views if you get a room on the 4th floor or higher. We were on the 5th and opened our shutters to an expansive view toward the west over colorful rooftops, apartments, even a cat wandering across the roofs of buildings below us. The room was small (standard European) and in need of thorough cleaning and painting. (The Nationale said painting was scheduled in 10 days.) Bed was very good and very large. Bathroom was clean (needed new paint).

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location Awful Bedroom”
Reviews.Author: AnonymousMidlandsUK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an ideal location and very quiet but the standard of the bedroom is definitely not 4 star. It was old fashioned, and felt dirty. There was a big red stain of something up the wall and the bathroom was poky and reminded me of showers you would get at an old fashioned swimming baths! Yes the bathroom was clean but overall the room felt dirty and we couldn't wait to get out of the hotel after four nights. We were on our honeymoon and were very disappointed particularly when we had to walk to the station in the rain because the Receptionist hadn't booked a taxi in enough time knowing that there would be a terrorist practice. Not somewhere I ever wish to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: CAMmuv3
Reviews.Content: We traveled with our 15 month old. Hotel Nazionale was a great Hotel. We stayed there for 4 nights. It was a perfect location, just a few steps from the Pantheon. The room was spacious and the bathroom was very clean. The hotel provided a crib. The front desk staff was very helpful. They organized a driver for us from the airport, told us about good restaurants etc. Our only complaint is that every morning around 2am we think the trash pick up came and it was pretty loud. Also there is some construction currently on the Parliament Building which is adjacent to Hotel Nazionale. Otherwise it was a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, no major complaints”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at this hotel in June, 2005. I was attracted mainly by the hotel's location, which, as expected, was fantastic. A great many of the major tourist attractions are within walking distance. As you know if you've visited Rome, the area can be extremely noisy at night, as people tend to stay out partying until the wee hours. Nazionale, however, looks out onto the piazza behind the Italian parliament building, which is extremely quiet at night, and patrolled by policemen, too. Quiet and safe. Good place for sleeping. The hotel itself was, well, fine. The common spaces are smallish, but quite nice. They gave us a free upgrade to a superior room, which had plenty of space, much of which was over our heads (the beautiful ceiling was at least 15 feet high). The antique furniture was lovely, if a little bit suboptimal in design. For example, a walk-in closet might have been nicer than the beautiful free-standing piece of furniture they offered. But one can't really complain about this sort of thing in a European hotel situated in a building that probably served some other purpose in the past. Above the desk there was a rather severe painting of a bare-chested young woman stabbing herself with a dagger under her right breast. We tried not to look at that just before retiring! Despite the abundant space available, our bed was a double, rather than a queen or king sized bed (why do they do this so often in Europe?) The air conditioning was a little bit weak, but not too bad. The bathroom was modern, and the plumbing worked just fine. The people working at the desk were friendly and helpful, and they spoke excellent English and other languages as well. We spent most of our time out of our room, and we weren't looking for many amenities. The hotel has a restaurant, in which I never saw a single person eating. I think there was a complimentary breakfast somewhere, but we never tried it. I have no major complaints about this hotel. It didn't overwhelm me with comfort, luxury, or warmth, but it was charming enough, and it served our purposes very well. It's in an absolutely excellent location, and there was nothing really wrong with it, which was good enough for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: phillydog
Reviews.Content: An older but historically interesting building. Inside, the rooms were clean and spacious. Probably the most significant asset is its location. It is located about 2 blocks from the Pantheon and Piazza Navona and less than 100 yards from a fantastic gellatoteria. Location can also be a detriment as you have to work hard to find a reasonably priced meal in the immediate vicinity (definitely avoid overpriced eateries in Piazza Navona). We never felt unsafe returning to our hotel after dark.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: jiminptc
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4-night stay at the Hotel Nazionale in Rome, and were very pleased with this hotel. The location is ideal for a tourist, since it is very centrally located in the old city, about 2 blocks from the Pantheon -very close to many popular places like the Piazza Navona & Trevi Fountain, and no more than a 20 minute walk to more distant attraction such as the Vatican, Forum, Spanish Steps, etc.. The hotel is very quiet, unlike many in Rome, because it is on the Piazza Montecitorio, which also faces the Parliament building - so there is absolutely no traffic going by the hotel (and plenty of policemen around). Taxis have access to the hotel, but have to turn around and go out the way they came in. The rooms & bathrooms were much larger than we had ever experienced in Europe before - we had a standard double and a single. In fact, the single was about the size we would expect for a standard double. The air conditioning was plentiful, and more than adequate for June. The staff is helpful and polite and they all speak good English. The breakfast was good, if standard - meats & cheeses, cereals, breads, etc. If this hotel is within your price range, I heartily recommend it. We have traveled to Rome several times, and if we ever go back this will be our first choice for a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: hipmama
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 5 day solo trip to Rome and my stay in the Nazionale made the trip spectacular! As the previous reviewers have said, the location could NOT be beat. A great central location just off Via Del Corso, and literally a 2 minute walk to the Pantheon, 5 minute walk to Trevi Fountain, 10 minutes to the Spanish Steps, Piazza Navona, and Campo dei Fiori. The Nazionale staff could not have been nicer. They gave me terrific directions to anywhere I needed to go, offered to arrange transportation for me, and always had a smile on their faces. My room was small but the bathroom was huge by European standards. The breakfast was in the typical afterthought European fashion but I definitely appreciated the available room service. If I ever go back to Rome, there is no doubt where I’ll be staying.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: richard03
Reviews.Content: We stayed 25th Feb till 28th Feb 2005. Originally booked into the Hotel White but transferred to this hotel (White overbooked or something). We could not have been more delighted with the location and the service provided by the staff of the Nazionale. The view from the room looked out over the parliament piazza. The bed was king size (i'm 1.93mtrs tall), it was furnished very tastefully. We would highly recommend this hotel. We were able to walk and see all the main sites and the Vatican is only a short taxi ride away. What a fanatastic weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located in a quite square right near the Pantheon, and in walking distance of every other main attraction. It is just steps away from the main shopping street, but also set back away from all the noise and crowds in a gorgeous little area with charming restaurants. We got a great deal through their website (nazionaleroma) in a superior room - pay 2 nights, stay 3, which worked out at about £130 a night. The room was absolutely beautiful with high ceilings, a view from windows with enormous shutters onto the square and gorgeous furniture. The service was great too, and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Why?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Hotel Nazionale. Having consulting pictures and comments on this sites we were curios to see what room we would get. Although the hotel was far from full, we were given a room with minimal furniture: 2 beds, 2 chairs, a small round table, and that was all! After complaining we were allocated a very nice room with a view on the roofs of Rome, with St Peter's and the Castello St Angelo as a backdrop. The only slight drawback was a slight smell of sewage in the bathroom. We fail to understand the allocation of the 1st. room. Was it because we were simple tourists instead of businessmen, and do not belong to the VIP category?

Reviews.Title: “Location can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: iluvitaly
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our second stay at this hotel. We will be staying there again in 3 months. It is on a traffic free piazza, just around the corner from the pantheon. The hotel is mainly geared to business people, the staff very professional and helpful and the public rooms immaculate and roomy with comfortable chairs and a bar open most all the time. The rooms range in size from standard european double to very large, the bathrooms have been recently renovated and supplied with fluffy towels and fresh bathrobes. the breakfast is one of the best we have had at any hotel in Italy. Nothing hot included but can be made to order. Good selection of breads, rolls, meats, cheeses, juices, fresh fruits etc etc. Although we were simply tourists we found the staff quite friendly and relaxed with us, discussing everything from soccer to the resident one-eyed cat that will be in the piazza around the entrance when you arrive. Got a great deal with go-today on this hotel with an air included package. They also offer stay 2 nights, get 1 free in off season.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Barbie12
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is in the perfect location. You can easily walk to all the attractions and the square is peaceful. No traffic noise and uncrowded. I have no complaints at all. Staff were polite and friendly and the room was clean and well kept. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location is not enough.”
Reviews.Author: sarah123
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night in June 2004. The wonderful location of this hotel - on a quiet square in the epicentre of Romes many attractions - is not enough to compensate for the dirt and tattiness of the bedroom I stayed in. Whilst, as usual, such hotels have lovely entrance hall, bar and lounge, I don't expect they have spent more than a Euro on the accomodation since 1970. The efficient, but formal, staff were adequate. The breakfast less than adequate. All in all, at the price of this 4 star hotel, a total let down. I'd never stay here again, not even if they adjusted the price to a more appropriate one-star rating. I moved to the Colonna Palace, just across the square, and although I was not entirely satisfied, it was far preferable and less expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 3 nights in first week September, hotel room and bathroom was large and very clean. We had a room overlooking the quite square yet only a very short walk to most of the sights. and Via Corso. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our trip was in Oct. 2003. The location is excellent - very safe streets, fairly quiet at night, and very easy walks to Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, and Forum. It was our anniversary, and I believe we received an upgraded room upon check-in. The staff was helpful, and the room was spacious with high ceilings, antique furniture and modern bath (2nd floor room). We felt it was a good value for our money. Note: cab fare from train station should be only E12-15, not the E50 "scenic" tour that we took!

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel with the Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: Melissa5
Reviews.Content: Hmmm...I am surprised to find conflicting reviews on this hotel, because we stayed there for 4 nights in June and this hotel is very classy, and has a very central and perfect location, an easy walk to the Pantheon, to the Trevi fountain, to Piazza Navona, and to many ristorantes, and right around the corner from Giolitti's, a friendly gelato place! I am thinking that some people may have this hotel mixed up with another hotel that is on the same piazza, or possibly they may have mixed it up with several other hotels with similar names! We had a double room and a triple room for our family of 5 people for 4 nights. Price included a nice breakfast buffet which offered cold cuts, cheeses, fruit, pastries, yogurt, cereal, and of course excellent cappuccino... Rooms were both very clean, very classy, comfty beds, and a good amount of space...The triple was a little...cozy, but there was room to move and room for everyone's luggage. The double had ample space. Decor was very tasteful and the room was well maintained. Bathrooms were a good size and very clean, with nice showers. I had requested a view for the double and had also requested that the double be located on the quiet side for sleeping at night. We had the perfect double room, on one of the upper floors with a nice view of the Piazza Montecitorio, which is very quiet at night as there are guards below for the national parliament, which is also on the same piazza, called the Piazza Montecitorio, and there aren't any restaurants on this quiet square, just 2 hotels and the national parliament. You can't ask for a better location. From this hotel, we walked to the Pantheon, Piazza Navona, Trevi fountain, Spanish steps, Roman Forum, Colosseum, and many wonderful ristorantes with atmospheric outside dining...We took the public bus to the Vatican Museums and St. Peter's. Public bus was convenient, although hot and crowded in June...But it's cheap and only a short ride! If you've read down this far, I can assure you that people who have posted awful reviews for this hotel have to be...confused. I seriously think they must be thinking of a different hotel! There is absolutely only one problem with this hotel...it's a little expensive for a family on a budget. But we definitely felt it was worth it, it was every inch a 4-star hotel! Also Rome is the place for a good 4-star hotel...I promise you you'll pay more in Venice for a classy 4-star hotel than you will in Rome...So splurge a little in Rome and then choose a nice well-rated 3-star hotel in Venice where hotel prices are ridiculous...

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After two weeks tour around Italy with my senior mother, we made our final stop at Hotel Nazionale and were pleasantly surprised by how convinence, quiet and safe the location is. (Indeed, it is the center of rome and there is 24 hours police security) Room is big, clean with great view. One great ice cream shop and several good restaurants are just around the corner. Every staff of the hotel was extremely friendly and helpful which really make it a home away from home for us. An italian hollywood movie star was one floor above us (Penthouse of couse). Highly recommand and think you might like us find it better than those extremely expensive hotels near the spanish steps. At lease, we did.

Reviews.Title: “1 Star Quality at 4 Star Rates!”
Reviews.Author: TRVLR06
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for 1 star quality at 4 star pricing the Hotel Nazionale is for you. I booked this hotel for a five night stay in June 2004 based on the recommendation of a trusted travel guide and the reviews listed here. I suppose the decor is being sold as ramshacked charm, but basically all it is rundown and dirty. The mattresses, curtains, carpeting and bathrooms appear as though they haven't been replaced since the early 1970s and in some instances probably haven't been cleaned since then either. The shower curtain and tiles were moldy and human hairs (other than my own) were visible in various corners of the room. I booked this hotel on a 'stay three pay for two night special' but checked-out after the second night thereby giving up a free night stay in Rome. I just could not handle anymore bed bug bites. I found a wonderful hotel around the corner next to the Pantheon that provided the cleanliness and service you expect when paying 4 star rates. Aside from my brief stay at the Hotel Nazionale, I found Rome to be a beautiful, friendly and obviously an historically fascinating city. I am looking forward to returning to Rome soon.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good place”
Reviews.Author: TexasSooner
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May 2004 and we would stay there again. Our room overlooked the piazza and was quite spacious as was the bathroom...especially considering we were in Europe! The breakfast was adequate and all the staff we came in contact with were very courteous. The location is truly outstanding. We walked everywhere. The quiet and the security of the piazza should be counted as a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “What A DUMP!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this dump, I mean hotel, in July 2003 and absolutely hated it. It's location is mediocre. The rooms are just awful -- wallpaper peeling, outdated decor, etc. The staff were not the least bit helpful and the cleaning staff were VERY loud from the moment they started cleaning at 7:30 am! We had just stayed at the Bauer in Venice so our arrival at this hotel was a shock. We were so disappointed with our room we almost checked out to find a better place to stay...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: lawahoo2001
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first 4 nights of our honeymoon in Sept. 2001. Awesome location. Centrally located to everything. You can walk everywhere, even the Vatican (this is the secret to not gaining weight while in Italy eating all that gelato and other great food). The Pantheon is right around the corner (it was my favorite place in all of Rome--it's absolutely magical at night). Even though it is in a central location, the hotel is very QUIET in this bustling city. It is located off of the road right next to a piazza where the Parliament is. So, there is no car traffic that goes by the hotel. There are a lot of police around Parliament, so it keeps the noise down from any rowdy people walking by. Our room was large and so was the bathroom (in comparison to some other hotels we stayed at in Italy). We would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for six nights at the beginning of March 2004. The hotel is great, large rooms, large bathroom, very clean, and the staff were helpful and friendly. Hotet is in great location; within walking distance of all tourist attractions, and has great resturants nearby. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Beutiful, Friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Nazionale for six nights around Thanksgiving. It was very convenient: within 30-45 minute walk to St. Peters,Roman ruins, Villa Borghesi, Trastaverte, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps. Gelatto shop around corner best in Italy. 20 minutes walk to best takeout in Rome. Staff very friendly and helpful. Great room. We had a corner room on the first floor overlooking the entrance to the Chamber of Deputies. We went with Go-Today. Tremendous deal. We hope to go back next year.
